infodynamics.measures.discrete

Class MultiInformationCalculatorDiscrete

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.discrete.InfoMeasureCalculatorDiscrete
      • infodynamics.measures.discrete.MultiInformationCalculatorDiscrete

  • public class MultiInformationCalculatorDiscrete
extends InfoMeasureCalculatorDiscrete

    Multi-information or integration calculator for multivariate discrete data. That is, it is applied to double[][] data, where the first index is observation number or time, and the second is variable number. See Tononi et al. below for the definition of multi-information/integration.

    Usage of the class is intended to follow this paradigm:

    1. Construct the calculator: MultiInformationCalculatorDiscrete(int, int);
    2. Initialise the calculator using initialise();
    3. Provide the observations/samples for the calculator to set up the PDFs, using one or more calls to sets of addObservations(int[][], int[]) methods, then
    4. Compute the required quantities, being (at this stage):
      • the average MI: computeAverageLocalOfObservations();
    5. Return to step 2 to re-use the calculator on a new data set.

    References:

    • "G. Tononi, O. Sporns, G. M. Edelman, "A measure for brain complexity: relating functional segregation and integration in the nervous system" Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, Vol. 91, No. 11. (1994), pp. 5033-5037.
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)

      • addObservations

        public void addObservations(int[] states,
                   int[] groupOffsets)
        Given one time sample of a homogeneous array of variables (states), add the observations of all sets of numVars of these, defined by the offsets in groupOffsets from every point in the array.
        Parameters:
        states - current values of an array of variables
        groupOffsets - offsets for the numVars set from a given data point

      • addObservations

        public void addObservations(int[] states,
                   int destinationIndex,
                   int[] groupOffsets)
        Given one time sample of a homogeneous array of variables (states), add the observations of one set of numVars of these, defined by the offsets in groupOffsets from destinationIndex.
        Parameters:
        states - current values of an array of variables
        destinationIndex - which variable to center our offsets from and take the sample,
        groupOffsets - offsets for the numVars set from a given data point

      • addObservations

        public void addObservations(int[][] states,
                   int[] groupOffsets)
        Given multiple time samples of a homogeneous array of variables (states), add the observations of all sets of numVars of these, defined by the offsets in groupOffsets from every point in the array. Do this for every time point
        Parameters:
        states - 2D array of values of an array of variables at many observations (first index is time, second is variable index)
        groupOffsets - offsets for the numVars set from a given data point
